steps.title: Hold your chicken wing in both hands.
steps.content: Hold your chicken wing in both hands. Place the wing in between your index finger and thumb of both hands. This way, you can easily remove the bones from either end. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Pull your chicken wing apart at the hinge if it is V-shaped.
steps.content: Pull your chicken wing apart at the hinge if it is V-shaped. If your chicken wing has a larger side and a shorter side, break the wing in half. Doing this lets you easily get the meat from the bones. [2] X Research source The V-shaped wing includes the wingette (larger part) and tip (smaller part) of the chicken wing. The wingette is attached to the drumette, which is the most common form of prepared chicken wings. [3] X Research source If your wing is not V-shaped, you do not have to do this.

steps.title: Eat the meat off the bone of the wing tip.
steps.content: Eat the meat off the bone of the wing tip. When getting the meat off of the smaller section, simply put the bone in your mouth and scrape off the meat. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Twist 1 end of the chicken wing to loosen the bone.
steps.content: Twist 1 end of the chicken wing to loosen the bone. Do this for either the wingette or the drumette. Pinch 1 end of the wing, and gently wiggle the bone back and forth to loosen it from the meat. [5] X Research source Twisting the bone makes it easier to remove it.

steps.title: Pull the bone straight out of the wing.
steps.content: Pull the bone straight out of the wing. After you loosen the bone, gently slide it out of the wing. It should easily slide out without much effort. [6] X Research source You can remove either the small or large bone first. It does not make a difference which bone you start with. Typically, the small bone is on top and the large bone is on the bottom.

steps.title: Twist the other end to remove the second bone.
steps.content: Twist the other end to remove the second bone. Pinch the opposite end of the wing with your index finger and thumb, and gently twist the bone back and forth to loosen it. Then, pull the bone straight out. [7] X Research source Chicken wings typically have 2 bones inside of them.

steps.title: Dunk your chicken wing into your favorite dipping sauce for extra flavor.
steps.content: Dunk your chicken wing into your favorite dipping sauce for extra flavor. While dipping sauce is optional, it adds flavor your wings. Fill up a small ramekin up with your sauce, and dip in the wing before you take a bite. [8] X Research source Choose dipping sauce like blue cheese, ranch, or hot sauce.

steps.title: Eat the boneless bite of chicken wing.
steps.content: Eat the boneless bite of chicken wing. Once you remove the 2 bones, you are left with a boneless chunk of meat. Take 1-2 bites to eat your boneless wing. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Hold the chicken wing in both of your hands.
steps.content: Hold the chicken wing in both of your hands. Before you take a bite, grip your chicken wing with your index finger and thumb. This way, you can easily tear into it and get the meat. [10] X Research source Do this for either the drumette or wingette.

steps.title: Bite into meat starting at the center.
steps.content: Bite into meat starting at the center. Take your first bite in the middle of the wing, in between the larger and smaller bone. [11] X Research source You should get a thick chunk of white meat.

steps.title: Turn the wing around in your hands and eat the meat as you go.
steps.content: Turn the wing around in your hands and eat the meat as you go. After you take your first bite, continue biting into the wing to get the meat. To do this, rotate the wing horizontally as you take your bites. [12] X Research source This way, you can get as much meat off the bones as possible.

steps.title: Clean the bone of any remaining meat and skin.
steps.content: Clean the bone of any remaining meat and skin. Once youâ€™ve eaten most of the meat off the bone, go around the ends and sides of the wing and bite off any remaining skin or meat. [13] X Research source You want the bone to be completely clean when you are finished.
